banner.tagline: GitHub Spec Kit - Spec-Driven Development Toolkit

init.git_not_found: Git not found - will skip repository initialization
init.warning_not_empty: Warning: Current directory is not empty ({count} items)
init.merge_warning: Template files will be merged with existing content and may overwrite existing files
init.force_skip: --force supplied: skipping confirmation and proceeding with merge
init.choose_different: Please choose a different project name or remove the existing directory.
init.error_invalid_ai: Error: Invalid AI assistant '{ai}'. Choose from: {options}
init.error_invalid_script: Error: Invalid script type '{type}'. Choose from: {options}
init.error_both_name_here: Error: Cannot specify both project name and --here flag
init.error_no_project_name: Error: Must specify either a project name, use '.' for current directory, or use --here flag

check.title: Checking for installed tools...
check.ready: Specify CLI is ready to use!
check.tip_git: Tip: Install git for repository management
check.tip_agent: Tip: Install an AI assistant for the best experience

lang.set_error: Language '{lang}' is not installed. Install it first with: specify lang install {lang}

steps.enhancement_description: Optional commands that you can use for your specs (improve quality & confidence)
steps.already_in_folder: You're already in the project directory!
steps.start_commands: Start using slash commands with your AI agent:
steps.clarify: /spec-mix.clarify (optional) - Ask structured questions to de-risk ambiguous areas before planning (run before /spec-mix.plan if used)
steps.checklist: /spec-mix.checklist (optional) - Generate quality checklists to validate requirements completeness, clarity, and consistency (after /spec-mix.plan)

security.title: Agent Folder Security
security.message:
Some agents may store credentials, auth tokens, or other identifying and private artifacts in the agent folder within your project.
Consider adding {folder} (or parts of it) to {gitignore} to prevent accidental credential leakage.

git.manual_instructions: You can initialize git manually later with:

normal.name: Normal Mode
normal.description: Guided workflow with auto-clarify and phase-based implementation

pro.name: Pro Mode
pro.description: Full control with individual commands for each workflow step
